speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir Hugh, persuade me not. I will make a

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Star-Chamber matter of it. If he were twenty Sir

speaker: SHALLOW
text: John Falstaffs, he shall not abuse Robert Shallow,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Esquire.

speaker: SLENDER
text: In the county of Gloucester, Justice of Peace

speaker: SLENDER
text: and Coram.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ay, Cousin Slender, and Custalorum.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, and Ratolorum too; and a gentleman born,

speaker: SLENDER
text: Master Parson, who writes himself “Armigero”

speaker: SLENDER
text: in any bill, warrant, quittance, or obligation—

speaker: SLENDER
text: “Armigero!”

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ay, that I do, and have done any time these

speaker: SHALLOW
text: three hundred years.

speaker: SLENDER
text: All his successors gone before him hath

speaker: SLENDER
text: done ’t, and all his ancestors that come after him

speaker: SLENDER
text: may. They may give the dozen white luces in their

speaker: SLENDER
text: coat.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: It is an old coat.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: The dozen white louses do become an old

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: coat well. It agrees well, passant. It is a familiar

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: beast to man and signifies love.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: The luce is the fresh fish. The salt fish is an

speaker: SHALLOW
text: old coat.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I may quarter, coz.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: You may, by marrying.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is marring indeed, if he quarter it.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Not a whit.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Yes, py ’r Lady. If he has a quarter of your

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: coat, there is but three skirts for yourself, in my

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: simple conjectures. But that is all one. If Sir John

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Falstaff have committed disparagements unto you,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: I am of the Church, and will be glad to do my

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: benevolence to make atonements and compromises

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: between you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: The Council shall hear it; it is a riot.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is not meet the Council hear a riot. There

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: is no fear of Got in a riot. The Council, look you,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: shall desire to hear the fear of Got, and not to hear

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: a riot. Take your visaments in that.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ha! O’ my life, if I were young again, the

speaker: SHALLOW
text: sword should end it.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is petter that friends is the sword, and end

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: it. And there is also another device in my prain,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: which peradventure prings goot discretions with

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: it. There is Anne Page, which is daughter to Master

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Thomas Page, which is pretty virginity.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Mistress Anne Page? She has brown hair

speaker: SLENDER
text: and speaks small like a woman?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is that fery person for all the ’orld, as just

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: as you will desire. And seven hundred pounds of

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: moneys, and gold, and silver, is her grandsire upon

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: his death’s-bed (Got deliver to a joyful resurrections!)

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: give, when she is able to overtake seventeen

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: years old. It were a goot motion if we leave our

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: pribbles and prabbles, and desire a marriage between

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Master Abraham and Mistress Anne Page.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Did her grandsire leave her seven hundred

speaker: SLENDER
text: pound?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Ay, and her father is make her a petter

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: penny.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I know the young gentlewoman. She has

speaker: SLENDER
text: good gifts.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Seven hundred pounds and possibilities is

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: goot gifts.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Well, let us see honest Master Page. Is Falstaff

speaker: SHALLOW
text: there?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Shall I tell you a lie? I do despise a liar as I

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: do despise one that is false, or as I despise one that

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: is not true. The knight Sir John is there, and I beseech

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: you be ruled by your well-willers. I will peat

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text:
the door for Master Page.
                 
                He
                 
                knocks
                .
               What ho?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Got pless your house here.

speaker: PAGE
text: Who’s there?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Here is Got’s plessing, and your friend, and

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Justice Shallow, and here young Master Slender,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: that peradventures shall tell you another tale, if

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: matters grow to your likings.

speaker: PAGE
text: I am glad to see your Worships well. I thank you

speaker: PAGE
text: for my venison, Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Master Page, I am glad to see you. Much

speaker: SHALLOW
text: good do it your good heart! I wished your venison

speaker: SHALLOW
text: better; it was ill killed. How doth good Mistress

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Page? And I thank you always with my heart, la,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: with my heart.

speaker: PAGE
text: Sir, I thank you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir, I thank you; by yea and no, I do.

speaker: PAGE
text: I am glad to see you, good Master Slender.

speaker: SLENDER
text: How does your fallow greyhound, sir? I

speaker: SLENDER
text: heard say he was outrun on Cotsall.

speaker: PAGE
text: It could not be judged, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text: You’ll not confess, you’ll not confess.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: That he will not. ’Tis your fault, ’tis your

speaker: SHALLOW
text: fault. ’Tis a good dog.

speaker: PAGE
text: A cur, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir, he’s a good dog and a fair dog. Can there

speaker: SHALLOW
text: be more said? He is good and fair. Is Sir John Falstaff

speaker: SHALLOW
text: here?

speaker: PAGE
text: Sir, he is within, and I would I could do a good

speaker: PAGE
text: office between you.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is spoke as a Christians ought to speak.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: He hath wronged me, Master Page.

speaker: PAGE
text: Sir, he doth in some sort confess it.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: If it be confessed, it is not redressed. Is not

speaker: SHALLOW
text: that so, Master Page? He hath wronged me, indeed

speaker: SHALLOW
text: he hath; at a word, he hath. Believe me. Robert

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Shallow, Esquire, saith he is wronged.

speaker: PAGE
text: Here comes Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Now, Master Shallow, you’ll complain of me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to the King?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Knight, you have beaten my men, killed my

speaker: SHALLOW
text: deer, and broke open my lodge.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: But not kissed your keeper’s daughter.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Tut, a pin. This shall be answered.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I will answer it straight: I have done all this.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: That is now answered.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: The Council shall know this.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’Twere better for you if it were known in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: counsel. You’ll be laughed at.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Pauca verba, Sir John, good worts.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Good worts? Good cabbage!—Slender, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: broke your head. What matter have you against

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me?

speaker: SLENDER
text: Marry, sir, I have matter in my head against

speaker: SLENDER
text: you and against your cony-catching rascals, Bardolph,

speaker: SLENDER
text: Nym, and Pistol.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: You Banbury cheese!

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, it is no matter.

speaker: PISTOL
text: How now, Mephostophilus?

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, it is no matter.

speaker: NYM
text: Slice, I say! Pauca, pauca. Slice, that’s my humor.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Where’s Simple, my man?

speaker: SLENDER
text: Can you tell, cousin?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Peace, I pray you. Now let us understand;

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: there is three umpires in this matter, as I understand:

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: that is, Master Page (fidelicet Master Page);

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: and there is myself (fidelicet myself); and the three

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: party is, lastly and finally, mine Host of the Garter.

speaker: PAGE
text: We three to hear it and end it between them.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Fery goot. I will make a prief of it in my

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: notebook, and we will afterwards ’ork upon the

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: cause with as great discreetly as we can.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Pistol.

speaker: PISTOL
text: He hears with ears.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: The tevil and his tam! What phrase is this,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: “He hears with ear”? Why, it is affectations.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Pistol, did you pick Master Slender’s purse?

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, by these gloves, did he—or I would I

speaker: SLENDER
text: might never come in mine own great chamber

speaker: SLENDER
text: again else—of seven groats in mill-sixpences,

speaker: SLENDER
text: and two Edward shovel-boards that cost me two

speaker: SLENDER
text: shilling and twopence apiece of Yed Miller, by

speaker: SLENDER
text: these gloves.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Is this true, Pistol?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: No, it is false, if it is a pickpurse.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Ha, thou mountain foreigner!—Sir John and

speaker: PISTOL
text: master mine, I combat challenge of this latten

speaker: PISTOL
text: bilbo.—Word of denial in thy labras here! Word of

speaker: PISTOL
text: denial! Froth and scum, thou liest.

speaker: SLENDER
text: By these gloves, then ’twas

speaker: SLENDER
text: he.

speaker: NYM
text: Be avised, sir, and pass good humors. I will say

speaker: NYM
text: “marry trap with you” if you run the nuthook’s

speaker: NYM
text: humor on me. That is the very note of it.

speaker: SLENDER
text: By this hat, then, he in the red face had it.

speaker: SLENDER
text: For, though I cannot remember what I did when

speaker: SLENDER
text: you made me drunk, yet I am not altogether an

speaker: SLENDER
text: ass.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What say you, Scarlet and John?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Why, sir, for my part, I say the gentleman

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: had drunk himself out of his five sentences.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is “his five senses.” Fie, what the ignorance

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: is!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: And being fap, sir, was, as

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: they say, cashiered. And so conclusions passed the

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: careers.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, you spake in Latin then too. But ’tis no

speaker: SLENDER
text: matter. I’ll ne’er be drunk whilst I live again but in

speaker: SLENDER
text: honest, civil, godly company, for this trick. If I be

speaker: SLENDER
text: drunk, I’ll be drunk with those that have the fear of

speaker: SLENDER
text: God, and not with drunken knaves.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: So Got ’udge me, that is a virtuous mind.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You hear all these matters denied, gentlemen.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You hear it.

speaker: PAGE
text: Nay, daughter, carry the wine in. We’ll drink

speaker: PAGE
text: within.

speaker: SLENDER
text: O heaven, this is Mistress Anne Page.

speaker: PAGE
text: How now, Mistress Ford?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Mistress Ford, by my troth, you are very well

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: met. By your leave, good mistress.

speaker: PAGE
text: Wife, bid these gentlemen welcome.—Come, we

speaker: PAGE
text: have a hot venison pasty to dinner. Come, gentlemen,

speaker: PAGE
text: I hope we shall drink down all unkindness.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I had rather than forty shillings I had my

speaker: SLENDER
text: book of Songs and Sonnets here!

speaker: SLENDER
text: How now, Simple? Where have you been? I must

speaker: SLENDER
text: wait on myself, must I? You have not the Book of

speaker: SLENDER
text: Riddles about you, have you?

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Book of Riddles? Why, did you not lend it to

speaker: SIMPLE
text: Alice Shortcake upon Allhallowmas last, a fortnight

speaker: SIMPLE
text: afore Michaelmas?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Come, coz; come, coz. We stay

speaker: SHALLOW
text: for you. A word with you, coz. Marry, this, coz:

speaker: SHALLOW
text: there is, as ’twere, a tender, a kind of tender, made

speaker: SHALLOW
text: afar off by Sir Hugh here. Do you understand me?

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, sir, you shall find me reasonable. If it be

speaker: SLENDER
text: so, I shall do that that is reason.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Nay, but understand me.

speaker: SLENDER
text: So I do, sir.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Give ear to his motions, Master Slender. I

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: will description the matter to you, if you be capacity

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: of it.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Nay, I will do as my cousin Shallow says. I

speaker: SLENDER
text: pray you, pardon me. He’s a Justice of Peace in his

speaker: SLENDER
text: country, simple though I stand here.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: But that is not the question. The question is

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: concerning your marriage.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ay, there’s the point, sir.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Marry, is it, the very point of it—to Mistress

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Anne Page.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Why, if it be so, I will marry her upon any

speaker: SLENDER
text: reasonable demands.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: But can you affection the ’oman? Let us command

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: to know that of your mouth, or of your lips;

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: for divers philosophers hold that the lips is parcel of

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: the mouth. Therefore, precisely, can you carry your

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: good will to the maid?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Cousin Abraham Slender, can you love her?

speaker: SLENDER
text: I hope, sir, I will do as it shall become one

speaker: SLENDER
text: that would do reason.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Nay, Got’s lords and His ladies! You must

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: speak positable, if you can carry her your desires

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: towards her.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: That you must. Will you, upon good dowry,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: marry her?

speaker: SLENDER
text: I will do a greater thing than that, upon your

speaker: SLENDER
text: request, cousin, in any reason.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Nay, conceive me, conceive me, sweet coz.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: What I do is to pleasure you, coz. Can you love the

speaker: SHALLOW
text: maid?

speaker: SLENDER
text: I will marry her, sir, at your request. But if

speaker: SLENDER
text: there be no great love in the beginning, yet heaven

speaker: SLENDER
text: may decrease it upon better acquaintance, when

speaker: SLENDER
text: we are married and have more occasion to know

speaker: SLENDER
text: one another. I hope upon familiarity will grow

speaker: SLENDER
text: more content. But if you say “Marry her,” I will

speaker: SLENDER
text: marry her. That I am freely dissolved, and

speaker: SLENDER
text: dissolutely.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: It is a fery discretion answer, save the fall is

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: in the ’ord “dissolutely.” The ’ort is, according to

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: our meaning, “resolutely.” His meaning is good.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ay, I think my cousin meant well.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, or else I would I might be hanged, la!

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Here comes fair Mistress Anne.—Would I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: were young for your sake, Mistress Anne.

speaker: ANNE
text: The dinner is on the table. My father desires

speaker: ANNE
text: your Worships’ company.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I will wait on him, fair Mistress Anne.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: ’Od’s plessèd will, I will not be absence at

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: the grace.

speaker: ANNE
text: Will ’t please your Worship to come

speaker: ANNE
text: in, sir?

speaker: SLENDER
text: No, I thank you, forsooth, heartily. I am very

speaker: SLENDER
text: well.

speaker: ANNE
text: The dinner attends you, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I am not ahungry, I thank you, forsooth.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Go, sirrah, for all you are my man, go

speaker: SLENDER
text:
wait upon my cousin Shallow. 
                (
                Simple
                 
                exits
                .
                )
               A

speaker: SLENDER
text: Justice of Peace sometime may be beholding to his

speaker: SLENDER
text: friend for a man. I keep but three men and a boy

speaker: SLENDER
text: yet, till my mother be dead. But what though? Yet

speaker: SLENDER
text: I live like a poor gentleman born.

speaker: ANNE
text: I may not go in without your Worship. They will

speaker: ANNE
text: not sit till you come.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I’ faith, I’ll eat nothing. I thank you as much

speaker: SLENDER
text: as though I did.

speaker: ANNE
text: I pray you, sir, walk in.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I had rather walk here, I thank you. I bruised

speaker: SLENDER
text: my shin th’ other day with playing at sword and

speaker: SLENDER
text: dagger with a master of fence—three veneys for a

speaker: SLENDER
text: dish of stewed prunes—and, by my troth, I cannot

speaker: SLENDER
text: abide the smell of hot meat since. Why do your

speaker: SLENDER
text: dogs bark so? Be there bears i’ th’ town?

speaker: ANNE
text: I think there are, sir. I heard them talked of.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I love the sport well, but I shall as soon quarrel

speaker: SLENDER
text: at it as any man in England. You are afraid if

speaker: SLENDER
text: you see the bear loose, are you not?

speaker: ANNE
text: Ay, indeed, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text: That’s meat and drink to me, now. I have

speaker: SLENDER
text: seen Sackerson loose twenty times, and have taken

speaker: SLENDER
text: him by the chain. But, I warrant you, the women

speaker: SLENDER
text: have so cried and shrieked at it that it passed. But

speaker: SLENDER
text: women, indeed, cannot abide ’em; they are very ill-favored

speaker: SLENDER
text: rough things.

speaker: PAGE
text: Come, gentle Master Slender, come. We stay for

speaker: PAGE
text: you.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I’ll eat nothing, I thank you, sir.

speaker: PAGE
text: By cock and pie, you shall not choose, sir! Come,

speaker: PAGE
text: come.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Nay, pray you, lead the way.

speaker: PAGE
text: Come on, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Mistress Anne, yourself shall go first.

speaker: ANNE
text: Not I, sir. Pray you, keep on.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Truly, I will not go first, truly, la! I will not do

speaker: SLENDER
text: you that wrong.

speaker: ANNE
text: I pray you, sir.

speaker: SLENDER
text: I’ll rather be unmannerly than troublesome.

speaker: SLENDER
text: You do yourself wrong, indeed, la!
